name: Les Volets Bleus

reviews.text: We drove down to Salleles for the annual wine walk, the Sentier Gourmand, a 6km walk through the vineyards of the La Clape district stopping at 6 stations where a course of the meal was served at each and several wines were available to taste - about 45 in all on the walk.
reviews.title: wine weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at les voletes bleus was a great pleasure. We have stayed before and the welcome was wonderful and the food good with several of us around the table in the evening.
reviews.title: We really enjoyed our stay!

reviews.text: I would recommend staying here. The situation is stunning by the canal which connects with the canal du midi. There is great walking and cycling available.
reviews.title: Great fun, gorgeous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in April and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay. The owners Isobel. Nick and Greg could not have made us more welcome and even let me take their dog Tinka for a walk along the canal! The house itself is delightful and is right opposite the Canal du Robin. We stayed in a massive room on the first floor with an equally massive bathroom and seperate dressing room overlooking the canal. We particularly enjoyed the evening meals which Isobel,who is a fantastic cook, prepared and everyone sits together at a large table and enjoys some convivial chat and lots of wine! The owners are brilliant at telling you what to visit and where to eat which was much appreciated, In fact their is a really great restaurant just round the corner Les Ecluses which I done a seperate revue on. We are hoping to visit again next year and join one of their wine walks which should quite an experience!
reviews.title: What a lovely special place to be

reviews.text: My Mom, sister and I had a fantastic stay in this gem of a B&B. An old vintner's mansion that sits canalside, it is absolutely charming. It is well located for visits along the canal and tastings through wine country. As noted in other reviews, Greg, Nick and Isobel are fantastic hosts and our dinner was one of the most fun nights we had during our trip to the region. Food was excellent and the wine was abundant! It was a very memorable experience for us and I would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Truly wonderful place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights at this lovely old house on the canalside in the heart of Salleles. The room was amazingly huge with a bathroom to match.Our hosts Nick Isobel, Greg and not forgetting Tinka, were most welcoming and sociable. Food was fabulous, cooked by Isobel fresh each evening, and accompanied by liberal helpings of good wine from a local Domaine, which you should visit if you can. La Laurie have been wine producers for 10 generations and it shows.There is plenty to see and do in the area, which our hosts know intimately and they are willing and able to assist in devising itinararies which are interesting and achievable. We will certainly be returning next year.
reviews.title: "Fantastic stay in a fabulous location "

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at Les Volets Bleus and wished it could have been longer. Great location on the Canal du Midi - our large room overlooked the canal. Hosts Isobel, Nick, Greg and Tinka the dog were all very welcoming. We ate dinner there for two of the nights which was a great experience as Isobel's culinary skills are excellent and all the guests are seated around the table together after enjoying aperitifs on the terrace overlooking the canal. It was a multi-lingual dinner party and was great fun! Breakfast was very good with the usual cereals, breads, fruit etc. The hosts' knowledge of local places to visit, restaurants and wine tasting was very helpful. Would love to return in the future.
reviews.title: Great location, great hosts, great big house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 Nights in August and could'nt fault the accomodation, food or the hospitality given. The room we stayed in was enormous with an equally large en-suite bathroom. Although no air-con the rooms remained cool thanks to the position of the house on the tree lined banks of the canal plus a supersize fan in the room !
reviews.title: Fantastic hospitality from Nick, Izzy and Greg

reviews.text: Either Nick, Izzy or Greg were always availble in an unobtrusive way with help or friendly advice and were more than generous with their 'honesty fridge' policy !
reviews.title: Pity it was only one night
Great stay at a great price
reviews.text: Breakfast was a good choice of cereals, fresh juice, fruit, croissants, bread tea or coffee served at a reasonable time. The house is an old wine merchants property from about the late 1800's and consequently some of the rooms did'nt have any keys for the doors. However this should'nt be a problem as there is always someone around and the house is in a quiet part of a sleepy village. The village itself boasts two restaurants, one a very reasonable cafe on the canal and the other slightly more expensive in the village itself.

We stayed at Les Volets Bleus in late May as the first night of a bike trip from Beziers to Toulouse. We came across it by chance (my wife spotted the "chambres d'hôtes" sign as we cycled into town) and it turned out to be the hotel hightlight of our trip. The canal-side setting is deligtful, the building itself imposing and decorated with taste, our enornous room was furnished simply but comfortably. But. as many have said before me, the hospitality is quite exceptional. I would recommend any hotelier to consider taking lessons from Nick and Izzy on how to manage that fine line between too formal and too informal. Our welcome was just perfect -- we felt instantly at home, but with our own space respected.
reviews.title: Other B&Bs should take lessons from Les Volets Bleus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have dinner at Les Volets Bleus so I can't comment, but breakfast was superb value for money (as was our whole stay).
reviews.title: Delighted to Return

reviews.text: Finally, thanks Nick for your recommended bike route from Salleles-d'Aude to Carcassonne. Just right and easy to follow -- our best day's cycling all the way to Toulouse.
reviews.title: Great B&B with nice rooms and excellent hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow - it wasn't a on-off; some 4 years later I return; and the best thing is - it hasn't changed one bit. Nick, Issy and Greg are still on the ball with their apparently laid-back, but actually well sorted and rehearsed, service and we were treated this time to their fabulous, in terms of both quality and value, table d'hotes, and they even made a great show of appearing to be interested in what their guests had to say and talk about. The house is lovely, the situation excellent for nearby vineyards, canals, cycling.... Gosh haven't they done well and don't they deserve it. See you in a few more years; or before that in Andorra xx
reviews.title: Excellent B&B with great hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for three nights and everything was just perfect. Best of all was the hospitality but also the standard of the rooms, the breakfeast and the location was very good. Definetely also recommends having dinner together with the other guests and the owners.
reviews.title: Lovely location and great hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time in this area of Provence. This bed & breakfast was quirky and charming. Staying here was like staying in the home of a long time friend. The room we had was very spacious and the bathroom was almost the same size of the bedroom.We faced front so we had a nice view of the boats coming down the canal. We opted to have dinner at the house the second evening and it was delicious and maybe even the best dinner I had the entire time I was in Provence. The breakfast is simple. A car is must because the town is a little sleepy and you will want to drive out and see the surrounding areas. Would like to come back again one day.
reviews.title: Cozy

reviews.text: I can really only agree with all that previous reviewers have said - a fantastic time was had at this really lovely B+B and Nick, Izzy and Greg did everything possible to make our stay really special. It is also a really lovely part of France and anyone who has not visited the Aude region should do so ASAP and include a few nights at this great venue. Make sure that you also have dinner on at least one night - the food and wine were way beyond excellent.
reviews.title: Everything was superb

reviews.text: Excellent location, friendly service, exceptional food, Nick and Izzy were delightful, so was Greg for our weekend stay. Lovely village, people were great. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: C'est tres magnifique!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night while driving down to the south west of France. Nick and Izzy were great hosts, the house was beautiful and the drinks and meal were fantastic. Highly recommend to anyone passing through this area
reviews.title: A great place!

reviews.text: I stayed with friends here for 4 nights, whilst attending the annual wine walk. Isobel, Nick and Greg are brilliant hosts. Extremely warm welcome, nothing is too much trouble, food is extremely good. If only they could have fixed the weather. I must not forget Tinker the dog, he is gorgeous.
reviews.title: Little Gem

description: Les Volets Bleus is a fantastic town house on the canal in Salleles d'Aude - handy for Carcassonne, Cathar Castles, Canal du Midi, the Mediterranean, road cycling, mountain-biking, motorbike tours, wine-tasting, and much, much more. Rated 3 Epis with Gites de France, we offer 5 huge en-suite rooms, a generous continental buffet breakfast, home-cooked evening meals with local wines. Plus a shady terrace, secure garage and a warm friendly welcome
